TextView.android:text: To begin, you'll want to set up a 'league' via the side menu. This will be used to customize rankings, including both roster and scoring settings, league type and related options, number of teams, and more. You can save several to switch between as needed, but be sure to refresh rankings if you do need to switch!

Once you have a league set up, you can get some rankings. This can be done via the side menu, and will aggregate several sources and types of rankings, injury status, sos, and much more for hundreds of players. They are customized to your league, so if you switch or update leagues, do refresh! You can then filter as needed via the filter icon in the top menu. \n\nClicking into a player or searching via the top bar will allow you to see more, and clicking and holding will add that player to your watch list (indicated by a star image). If you click the title of the top bar, it'll scroll to the top.

Once you click on a player or search for one, you'll get all the information the app has. 
-By default, it shows specific ranks for that player, the first tab. 
-The second tab is player info, things specific to that player but outside of ranks, including a slot to save a custom per player note and tags you (and others) can assign. 
-Third is team info, which is relevant info about the player's team. 
-The fourth is news, where the app will try to get the latest news about that player. 
-The fifth and final tab is a per-player comment section, where you can discuss a player with others. You can delete your comments by clicking and holding on them.

From the menu, you can draft/undraft a player (more info below) or add them to/remove them from your watch list.

The app can be used to be a live reference as you draft, hiding drafted players and adjusting numbers as you go. You can draft players from two places - the player info page menu and the rankings list, by swiping (left to someone else's team, right to your own). \n\nAs you draft, the app will track the current state. You can see your team (as well as some metrics) via the first button on the bottom menu. This will also show you the PAA remaining a few spots back at each position. If you accidentally drafted someone, you can also undraft someone from here.

Curious to see what the odds are a player is available in a certain pick/scenario? The ADP simulator checks against adp data to give you an exact number, and is accessible through the fourth option in the bottom menu. Just enter a player and the pick, and see what your odds are!

Stuck between two players? You can enter any two players, and the app will compare every piece of info for each. In addition, it will check what percentage of experts prefer one to the other. Clicking on the name of either player will expand all of their info. This is accessible through the second option in the bottom menu.

Curious to sort by something other than ecr or auction value? The sort players button lets you pick any combination of factors, positions, and additional requirements! Much like the rankings, clicking on a player will expand the rest of their information, and clicking and holding will add them to your watch list. Clicking the title on the top bar will scroll to the top. This is accessible through the fourth option in the bottom menu.

Accessible via the side menu, pick from your preferred news source to get the latest and greatest fantasy football news! If a player is named in the news, click on it to expand that player's information.
Want to get these rankings onto some other platform? The side menu has an option to export all of these rankings as a csv to be used elsewhere!
Want to change your password, or even just sign out? Both are accessible via the side menu.

- ECR: The average overall expert ranking for that player. 

- Risk: the variation in rankings for that player. 

- ADP: The average draft position for that player. 

- Dynasty/Keeper ranking: The overall expert ranking for a player in keeper or dynasty start up drafts. 

- Rookie ranking: The overall expert ranking for a player in rookie drafts. 

- Auction value: The average auction value provided/calculated for that player. 

- Leverage: The relation of the projection and auction value for that player to that of the top projected player at the same position. 

- Projection: The average projection for that player, based on current league settings. 

- PAA: A value based drafting metric, relating projection to the average of the number of players at that projection that will be played that year. 

- XValue: Another value based drafting metric, instead related to the projections of the number at that position drafted in the first 100 picks of a draft, on average. 

- VOLS: a third value based drafting metric, which compares projection against the projected last started player. 

- All value based drafting metrics also have scaled versions, which scale down based on number of drafted players and roster requirements. 

- All value based drafting metrics also have metrics relating the numbers to auction values to help normalize between the two.
